item.title: James add a quote by Tanith Lee
item.description: "How massively the mountains stand, while low to the ground the sand blows. The sand blows on and on. And then there are no mountains, none at all, the sand has kissed and whispered them away. And still, the sand blows on." -- Tanith Lee

item.title: James add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: James add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "There are so many fragile things, after all. People break so easily, and so do dreams and hearts." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: James add a quote by Hannah More
item.description: "Love never reasons but profusely gives......gives like a thoughtless prodigal, it's all and trembles then, lest it has done too little. " -- Hannah More

item.title: James add a quote by Lora Brody
item.description: "Don't wreck a sublime chocolate experience by feeling guilty. Chocolate isn't like premarital sex. It will not make you pregnant. And it always feels good." -- Lora Brody

item.title: James add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The true measure of a man is not his intelligence or how high he rises in this freak establishment. No, the true measure of a man is this: how quickly can he respond to the needs of others and how much of himself he can give." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: James add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: James add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "One of the biggest, and possibly the biggest, obstacle to becoming a writer... is learning to live with the fact that the wonderful story in your head is infinitely better, truer, more moving, more fascinating, more perceptive, than anything you're going to manage to get down on paper. (And if you ever think otherwise, then you've turned into an arrogant self-satisfied prat, and should look for another job or another avocation or another weekend activity.) So you have to learn to live with the fact that you're never going to write well enough. Of course that's what keeps you trying -- trying as hard as you can -- which is a good thing." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: James add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "When you write your first novel you don't really know what you're doing. There may be writers out there who are brilliant, incisive and in control from their first 'Once upon a time'. I'm not one of them. Every once upon a time for me is another experience of white-water rafting in a leaky inner tube. And I have this theory that while the Story Council has its faults, it does have some idea that if books are going to get written, authors have to be able to write them." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: James add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "It is a much more straightforward thing to be a dog, and a dog's love, once given, is not reconsidered." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: James add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "That which is dreamed can never be lost, can never be undreamed." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: James add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Before you become too entranced with gorgeous gadgets and mesmerizing video displays, let me remind you that information is not knowledge, knowledge is not wisdom, and wisdom is not foresight. Each grows out of the other, and we need them all." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: James add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "The odd thing about people who had many books was how they always wanted more." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: James add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: James add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: James add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Do you know that books smell like nutmeg or some spice from a foreign land? I loved to smell them when I was a boy. Lord, there were a lot of lovely books once, before we let them go." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: James add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Whenever women have insisted on absolute equality with men, they have invariably wound up with the dirty end of the stick. What they are and what they can do makes them superior to men, and their proper tactic is to demand special privileges, all the traffic will bear. They should never settle merely for equality. For women, "equality" is a disaster." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: James add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I don't believe in colleges and universities. I believe in libraries because most students don't have any money. When I graduated from high school, it was during the Depression and we had no money. I couldn't go to college, so I went to the library three days a week for 10 years." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: James add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Anything you dream is fiction, and anything you accomplish is science, the whole history of mankind is nothing but science fiction. " -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: James add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: James add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Oh, what strange wonderful clocks women are. They nest in Time. They make the flesh that holds fast and binds eternity. They live inside the gift, know power, accept, and need not mention it. Why speak of time when you are Time, and shape the universal moments, as they pass, into warmth and action?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: James add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The first step in making rabbit stew is catching the rabbit." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: James add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description:
"I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.
[<i>IRC discussion at Scifi.com</i>, 1 November 1996]" -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: James add a quote by Patricia C. Wrede
item.description:
"Well,” said the frog, “what are you going to do about it?”
“Marrying Therandil? I don’t know. I’ve tried talking to my parents, but they won’t listen, and neither will Therandil.”
“I didn’t ask what you’d said about it,” the frog snapped. “I asked what you’re going to do. Nine times out of ten, talking is a way of avoiding doing things." -- Patricia C. Wrede

item.title: James add a quote by Charles Stross
item.description: "Gene police! You! Out of the pool, now!" -- Charles Stross

item.title: James add a quote by Robert Heinlein
item.description: "Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig." -- Robert Heinlein

item.title: James add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "And [Asimov]'ll sign anything, hardbacks, softbacks, other people's books, scraps of paper. Inevitably someone handed him a blank check on the occasion when I was there, and he signed that without as much as a waver to his smile — except that he signed: 'Harlan Ellison." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: James add a quote by Charles Stross
item.description: "The encapsulated bird your conspirators sent you to fetch. The sterilized male chicken with the Creator DNA sequences. The plot capon. Where is it?" -- Charles Stross

item.title: James add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: James add a quote by C. J. Cherryh
item.description: "Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!" -- C. J. Cherryh
